title: Classic retro thin san serif font
content:
Looking to do some graphics for this liquor store but they do not know what font was used on their sign. I have looked and cannot identify. Any help would be greatly appreciated! Thank you in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317150443im_/http:/typophile.com/files/EastCrawford_4179.jpg)

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317150443/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [EastCrawford.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317150443/http:/typophile.com/files/EastCrawford.jpg) | 788.09 KB |
author: xsharezx

comments.content:
Parisian by Morris Fuller Benton (American Type Founders-Kingsley):

[http://www.fonts.com/font/adobe/parisian/parisian](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317150443/http:/www.fonts.com/font/adobe/parisian/parisian "http://www.fonts.com/font/adobe/parisian/parisian")
Thank you kthomps5!! I really appreciate your help! Typophile users come through again!
